result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BTC: Matter set over.

Racine County Alternatives Program - Progress Report.

8:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Antoine Pinkney not in court.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels not in court. Court Reporter: Saige Smith  
Defendant and Attorney Samuels are both out ill. Attorney Samuels has contacted the court to waive his appearance this morning and to reschedule this hearing. 
State does not object to adjourning this matter. Asks that the court issues a bench warrant and bnond forfeiture but that it is stayed until the next court date. 
BTC: Bench warrant and bond forfeiture will be stayed until next court date. Matter set over.

State's NOI to Intro Recorded Statements
State's Demand for Discovery
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim M.G(person, property, residence or family). Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.
